intro: Chamissoa commutata, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, often found in mountainous regions. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine pubescence. Chamissoa commutata is known for its early spring blooming period, making it a notable wildflower in its native range.
